description: Expansion of theta_3(q)^2 * theta_3(q^3) in powers of q.
formula: Number of integer solutions to x^2 + y^2 + 3*z^2 = n.Euler transform of period 12 sequence [4, -6, 6, -2, 4, -9, 4, -2, 6, -6, 4, -3, ...]. - _Michael Somos_, Sep 21 2005Expansion of (eta(q^2)^2 * eta(q^6))^5 / (eta(q)^2 * eta(q^3) * eta(q^4)^2 * eta(q^12))^2 in power of q. - _Michael Somos_, Sep 21 2005G.f.: theta_3(q)^2 * theta_3(q^3).
mathematica: CoefficientList[EllipticTheta[3, 0, q]^2*EllipticTheta[3, 0, q^3]+O[q]^80, q] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 27 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
